hits the top of the hill and goes airborne... SLAMS back  down to the pavement.
Korda floors it, and we get a frightening view out the  windshield as they head straight downhill. The salesgirl beyond petrified.
reaches the top of the hill. Going fast.
As it rocks forward violently. Front bumper slamming agai the pavement. McCall sees the van ahead. Hammers the  accelerator. No fear.
Korda sees traffic ahead... Intersection jammed. He pulls hard left.
cuts straight across the corner... up on the sidewalk...  shears a mailbox... a row of newspaper machines fly throu the air... The van speeds off down a one-way street...

arrives at the intersection a few seconds later...  Intersection still jammed... People now standing on the c gawking at the damage. The Caddy SCREECHES to a stop. McC HONKS... The people scatter... The Cadillac drives throug the corner.

Wrong way down a one-way street. Cars coming right at us every angle. Frantic HONKING. Salesgirl SHRIEKS. Tires  SMOKING... No way to avoid collision... Except Korda pull left an instant before impact... The van speeds back up t hill.
Down the same one way street... Comes up on the head-on  traffic, now stopped, paralyzed with fear from the near  collision with Korda...
The Cadillac roars around the corner and heads up the hil

Korda, checking the rear view mirror. The Caddy is a shor distance behind. Attention still focused behind, Korda en an intersection, running a red light... CROSS-TRAFFIC...  Korda stiffens... Pulls on the wheel
The van swerves... But not quick enough... GRINDING metal SHATTERING glass... The van rolls over another car...
Korda and the salesgirl tossed about as the van does a  dizzying roll...

...and CRASHES back down to the street upside down. After beat, Korda crawls from the wreckage carrying the satchel jewels. The salesgirl does not emerge. He spots a cable c reaching the top of the hill and starting its long descen He heads toward it...
As Korda comes toward them from the wreckage, some of the passengers view him uneasily.
hits the top of the hill just in time for Rope and McCall see Korda leap onto the moving cable car.

other passengers give Korda room. They can sense that he not here merely for the ride. Korda looks out the back... Roper and McCall haven't lost track of him. The Cadillac making up ground on the cable car. Korda moves to the back exit, pulls his gun and FIRES off couple of shots at the Caddy.
A bullet fractures the windshield. McCall swerves.

That makes up the minds of many of the passenger. They le off the cable car. Korda takes aim on the Caddy again and FIRES! The brakeman charges down the aisle while Korda has his  attention focused out the back and tries to shove him off the cable car... Almost works... but Korda is able to hang on by one hand. He swings around toward the Brakeman who turns involuntar as he sees the barrel of the gun pointed at him... BANG!  Korda shoots him in the back. The brakeman staggers down the aisle and slumps across th brake lever, releasing it more.
The brakes are stressed.
Now driverless, the cable car picks up speed... Broadside car... Pushing it into parked cars...
Korda and the remaining passengers are rocked around.
THUNDERS towards us... Filling the FRAME...
Shows the cable car leaving the wreckage in its wake.
It passes the smashed car. McCall looks at the speedomete as he paces the cable car. It's going at 45 mph.
What the fuck is going on.
I don't know, but I've got to get on  there.
You're crazy.
Pull up alongside.
The cable car barrels through... Plows into two cross-tra cars... Knocks them aside... Keeps picking up speed.
Weaves through the wreckage... Makes up ground on the cab car, trying to pull alongside.
For the moment, Korda is not shooting at the Caddy. His  attention is now focused downhill as...
The cable car nails another vehicle sending it spinning o to the side.
dodges the spinning car... Jumps up onto the sidewalk...  Mows down parking meters... Jumps back onto the street.
Korda leans out the door, takes aim at the Caddy... Anoth jammed intersection up ahead...

location: CAR OF MAN TRAPPED IN INTERSECTION

text: He sees the cable car coming in his rear view mirror. He  bails out...
SLAMS into the back of the car. Major impact.
Korda and the passengers are thrown to the floor.
Tumbles down the hill... Hits a car coming uphill and rol into a parked car.
Speeds up alongside the cable car. Roper climbs over the  windshield, onto the hood and leaps onto the cable car.
Korda sees him coming. FIRES. Roper dives out the other s of the cable car.

Roper hanging off the side. He gets his gun out of his  holster... Up ahead, a car pulls away from the curb... Roper swings around to get back into the relative safety the cable car. As he does his gun is raked out of his han by the car which avoids a collision by a millimeter.
Korda aims as Roper re-enters...

As it CRASHES into the back of a car turning left. Everyone is thrown toward the front of the car. Korda's g goes flying. Roper dives on top of him. They trade punche McCall is in b.g. with the Caddy pacing the cable car.
Pedestrains bolt out of the way as the cable car streaks  through...
Roper hammers Korda into unconsciousness. Outside McCall honking and yelling like crazy. Roper looks over... McCal points ahead...
The cable car.
Leaps to the brake lever. Pulls on it.
The clamp tries to slow the descent. It whine and smokes. Then disintegrates before our eyes.
Roper feels the lever go slack in his hands. The cable ca is speeding toward the end of the line... No way to stop  it... Roper turns and takes a running leap into the Caddy

He lands in the passenger seat. Roper pounds his foot dow on the accelerator. The Caddy lunges ahead of the cable c McCall can't figure out what he's doing. Roper yanks the  steering wheel hard right...

The Caddy collides with the front of the cable car. Tires SCREAM. The steel wheels CLATTER. A cloud of burning rubb forms. The cable car grinds forward pushing the Cadillac. But it's working. The cable car is slowing.
The crowd now sees the Caddy and cable car bearing down o them. General hysteria as they flee.
Korda regains consciousness. Sees what's going on. He gra the satchel and bails out of the cable car...
...Onto the hood of a passing taxi. The taxi slams on its brakes. Korda rolls off the hood, picks himself up and ru into an underground garage.
Grinding to a halt just short of the end of the line. Rop grabs McCall's gun off the seat and leaps out of the Cadd to pursue Korda. People approach to ogle the two vehicles astonishment.

Roper moves up an interior stairway, gun in "ready" posit He knows Korda is somewhere in the parking structure. He  glides up the stairway to the third level. Checks back ov the rail... No one around... Then a sound from inside the garage... Footsteps maybe. Roper carefully opens the door... Swings in with his gun.

Lots of cars, but no one in sight. Roper moves quickly to the protection of a row of cars... He crouches down. Scan beneath the cars... No sign of Korda. Roper searches between two rows... Comes up beside a van. Thinks he hears something stirring inside. Whirls a gun t the window. A dog lunges at the CAMERA... Snarling... baring teeth... Roper moves on.

As a BMW crawls through the parking structure. Roper step into the FOREGROUND, right into its path, gun visible. Th BMW rolls to a stop. Roper approaches with caution. Roper comes up beside the car and sees a very frightened year old blonde. Roper takes a check out of the backseat.
Sorry, go.
The woman rolls up the window and hits the gas. She drive off.

Roper stands in the middle of the garage and takes a fina scan... He has the discouraging feeling that Korda might  have escaped. He heads toward the exit... Suddenly a SCREECH of tires.. Roper whirls to see a sedan bearing down on him. He drive and FIRES! Bullets shatter the windshield. The car continues toward Roper. He has to roll out of the path of the car. The car swerves past Roper. Tries to mak it down the ramp. Roper fires again, taking out the rear  window and a rear tire. The car slides along the guard ra and continues down to the next level. Roper runs after it

As the car reaches the next level, Korda loses control an piles into a parked car. Korda crawls out of the car clutching his precious satche of jewels. Dazed, he staggers away from the wreck. Roper moves to him with a face grim as death. He strips t satchel from Korda's hand and slams him against the open door. Korda goes to his knees. Roper holds the barrel of gun right up between Korda's eyes.
Give me one reason why I shouldn't  kill you right here.
Korda stares back at Roper defiantly. He knows a cop won' kill him in cold blood... What he doesn't know is that Roper doesn't give a shit ab those rules at this moment.
You know Sam Baffert was a friend of  mine. He had a wife... and he had a  daughter.
Korda stares past the barrel of the gun.
I don't give a shit about you or  your fucking friends.

And that makes Roper even angrier... But he keeps it all  inside. His expression is as cold as a San Francisco nigh He yanks back hard on Korda's hair. Pushes the gun tighte against Korda's forehead. He's on the verge of executing  this guy.
You can't kill me like this.
What if you and me got into a  struggle... and my gun went off?
In a flash, Roper points the gun upward and fires off a S
Could I kill you then? (beat, beat) Could I kill you then?

Roper jams the gun back under Korda's chin. A pull of the trigger would send a bullet straight up through Korda's s And now Korda is fully convinced. He squeezes his eyes cl Face straining so hard, he looks like he's going to burst out of his skin.
moving across garage into position.
Roper! Put it down!... Put it down  man, we got him. (beat) Come on... Put it down.

Long, long beat. Roper eases up and Korda smiles. Just wh we feel the scene is over, Roper turns back quickly and k Korda in the stomach, then grabs Korda by the hair, pulls his head back and shoves the gun in his face.
We do this shit by the book, but you  ain't gonna be smiling.
Korda is doubled up coughing, spitting up blood. Roper wa away as McCall moves in to put the cuffs on Korda.
Sequence omitted from original script.

Roper is sitting in a cubicle doing paperwork. A group of reporters and photographers move down the hallway adjoini the squadroom. One of them is Ronnie. Through the glass w she notices Roper sitting alone at the computer. She bids good-night to the reporters and comes into the squadroom.
You weren't at the press conference.
Roper keeps tapping away at the computer.
I wanted to get this out of the way.
You got a bet on the game tonight?
As a matter of fact, I do.
She nods knowingly.
It's already started.
I was going to catch the last half  on TV.
Ronnie watches him for a moment. He stops typing, looks a her and smiles. She suddenly becomes self-conscious. Gues it was something she was thinking.
Good-night.
She turns abruptly to leave. Roper finds himself rising f his chair.
You having dinner with Mr. Baseball?
She turns back around.
Greg is on a road trip. I was just  going to make some pasta.
He takes a few steps toward.
That kind with the garlic and the  oil that I like so much?
No. The kind from Kraft, with the  macaroni and the cheese.
I've been craving that stuff all  week.
And it's hard to get.
He looks at her innocently.
Just dinner.
Sequence omitted from original script.
Ronnie is making macaroni. Roper helps to prepare a dress to go with the salad. He is mixing oil, vinegar, sugar an spices. He lets her have a taste.
What do you think?
Mmm, needs a little something.
What are you talking about? This is  it. This is the stuff right here. (beat; he tastes) Well, maybe just a pinch more sugar.
Yeah that's it.
Why don't you just stick your finger  in and stir it up.
(laughing) Scottie...
There is a long pause as he looks at her.
What would you say if I quit gambling?
Ronnie stirs the macaroni.
I'd say you'd be miserable... It's  not the gambling. It's what the  gambling got in the way of. The track  is where you'd take your troubles  instead of sharing them with me...
Ronnie puts the lid on the macaroni. There is a beat befo she continues.

Scottie, remember the day you lost  that hostage in union square. You  came over that night and we made  mad, crazy love. But I didn't even  know what happened... 'til I heard  it on the news the next morning.
It's because I wanted to keep you  away from that world.
It's not that world. It's your world.  It's part of who you are.

(beat) Veronica, it's not easy for me... I  don't know if I can change overnight.  But what I'm telling you is that I  want to share everything with you,  because I don't ever want to be  without you again.
The dog yawns. They laugh. Roper moves closer to her. He  kisses her and she responds.
The lovemaking is over. Roper is gazing at the ceiling,  thinking. Ronnie is cuddled around him. A comfortable  moment...
What about Greg? What are you gonna  tell him?
It's okay. We broke up.
(surprised) When?
Just now.

Clarence Teal, Korda's cousin sits in front of the plexig wall. He's edgy, fidgety. Clarence doesn't like to make v to jail. Korda, wearing prison clothes, is led in by a guard. Kord takes a seat at the other side of the plexiglass wall and picks up the receiver. Clarence picks up his receiver.
How ya doin', man?
Korda grips the phone, leans forward and stares through t wall.
You gotta do something for me...  this fucker, Roper, he's gotta  girlfriend. She works at the  newspaper. I want you to take care  of her.
Clarence is totally unnerved by this request.
Hey, Michael, that's not my thing.
Korda glares at him murderously.
You gotta do this for me. I'm in  here because of you.
Man, what's this about? Ya know, you  were robbing a store. It wasn't  personal. It was his job.
(exploding) Fuck you! You know what he did to  me?!...
Korda starts to draw the attention of the guard. He contr himself, lowers his voice. But the viciousness is still t
He held a gun to my head and said he  should kill me right then... He made  me...
He doesn't finish that thought.
You do this for me Clarence.
Clarence is getting very upset.
Don't make do it, Mike.
Are you going to turn on me too? Who  helped you when you were strung out?  Who gave you money? Who bailed you  out of jail?
I won't get away with it.
Nobody knows who you are. Make it  look like a robbery.
Clarence holds back tears, because he knows he's going to have to do this.
A gray San Francisco evening. It starts to rain.
She's cooking some kind of sauce. She has a taste.
A subjective POV watching through the window as she moves around the kitchen.
Ronnie pours some oil in a pan. The phone RINGS. She cros the kitchen to answer it.
Roper on his cell phone. Paco is on the seat beside him.
Hi, I'm going to stop at the corner  for some wine.
Roper notices the rain, searches for the windshield wiper switch.
How's Paco doing?
He was going nuts at the park. He  met this very attractive poodle.  They made plans to meet again next  weekend.
Paco sits there panting. Roper pulls the pickup over in f of the store.
Okay, dinner will be ready when you  get here.
She hangs up.
Through the window we watch her cross back to the stove.
Ronnie lifts the lid on the sauce. Stirs. It spatters on blouse. She regards the stain with dismay. Puts the lid b on and leaves the kitchen.
Ronnie unbuttons her blouse as she moves to the...

She takes off the blouse, goes to the closet door... thro it open. She looks around. Something's not right. She tak a step into the closet and finds what she's looking for - laundry basket -- tucked away in the corner. She puts the soiled blouse in the hamper and takes a fresh one off a  hanger. She buttons the clean blouse as she walks to...
Dark. She turns on the light. She goes to the mirrored  medicine cabinet.

Behind her the shower curtain is drawn, fluttering ever s slightly. She opens the medicine cabinet. Takes out some  perfume. Dabs some on her neck. She puts back the bottle closes the cabinet. We fully expect someone to be standin right behind her in the reflection... There's no one ther She turns off the light as she walks out of the bathroom.

Ronnie walks back to the kitchen... Notices something on floor further down the hallway... What is it? She moves  closer... And now we get to the POV that tells us someone in the house... Watching her through a cracked doorway.
A hand opening a buck knife. Water drips from the fingers
Ronnie bends down. It's a wet spot. Like half a shoeprint She reaches down to touch it... BUZZZZZ!!!! The oven timer. She hurries back to the kitch

She turns off the timer and pulls some chicken out of the oven. She puts it down on the counter and cross to the  refrigerator. She opens the door and looks inside. The  refrigerator door obscures half the FRAME... She digs aro for something... We're sure that when she closes the door he's going to be behind it... She takes out a head of let and... Closes the door... Still no one there. She turns... Clarence is standing there. Dripping wet. Ro shrieks... The knife flashes forward... She grabs the lid from the sauce pan and CLANG... Fends off the blade. She  bolts for the hallway. Clarence grabs her by the blouse.. RIP! She pulls away.

She races down the hall. Clarence lunges into FRAME. She  goes down... He goes down... the knife goes skidding down the hallway... Ronnie scrambles to get it... Clarence has her by the ankle... She claws for the knife... Just out o reach.

Roper's pickup pulls up in front. He gets out. Paco jumps out behind him. It's raining harder. They hurry up the wa toward the house. Suddenly Roper realizes he forgot the w He goes back to the truck. Paco pads after him. Roper opens the driver's side door, reaches in and grabs wine. He closes the door, starts away, but pauses to chec himself in the window. Suddenly, a floodlight comes crashing through Ronnie's fr bay windows. It SPARKS and FLASHES. Still plugged in, it  bungees to a stop hallway down the front of the house.  FLICKERING and FLASHING. Roper rushes toward the house... Crashes through the fron door... Up the stairway... Paco bounds after him... Roper hits her front door running... Wham! He bounces off. He  shoulders it again... The door doesn't give... He pulls o his gun... BAM! BAM! Shoots off the lock.
A QUICK SHOT of Clarence's hand grabbing the knife.
Roper kicks open the door. Charges in.
Ronnie is laying on the floor, gasping for air. Choke mar around her throat. Roper rushes to her side. Paco is on h heels.
You okay?!
She nods. Points out the back way.
(to Paco) Stay.
The dog obediently stays with Ronnie. Roper dashes out th back.

Raining more heavily now. Roper bursts out onto the back  porch. Sees Clarence leaping off the last rung of the fir escape to the alley. Roper flies down the fire escape...  Vaults the last flight and races after Clarence.

Clarence sprints down the block... Through the intersecti HONK! SCREECH! A car barely misses him. It does a one-eig on the rain-slick pavement. Clarence disappears into the  shadows. Roper arrives a beat later... Streaks through th intersection... Into the shadows.

This one is steep. Clarence huffs and puffs as he labors. shoots into a doorway. Tries the door. Locked. He looks b Roper is coming. Relentless. He rushes across the steep  street. Almost slips on the reflective asphalt. Roper spo him crossing and picks up the pace. He can see that Clare is faltering.

head_text.subj: NEAR THE TOP OF THE HILL

text: Clarence staggers into an alleyway...

Narrow, dark and dripping with rain. Roper arrives at the mouth of the alley. Gun ready, he moves cautiously, eyes  adjusting to the darkness. The PATTER of rain off the  rooftops. His FOOTSTEPS. No other sound. He reaches the end of the alley... A brick wall. No way o Or so it would seem. However, Clarence is nowhere in sigh Roper turns back. Brick walls tower on both sides, rising into darkness. Roper checks a steel door. Locked. He chec another one on the opposite side of the alley. Also locke Where did Clarence go? He moves back toward the misting l of the street... Slowly... The FAINT RATTLE of a fire escape... And Clarence leaps d out of the shadow. Slashing with the knife. He catches Ro across the arm. Rips through his clothes right down to the skin. Roper's CLATTERS under a parked car and into the street. Clarence has first jump. He scrambles into the street, around the and grabs the gun... Roper dives over the hood of the car and knocks Clarence  down before he can aim. They roll into the middle of the  street. Both have a death grip on the weapon. Clarence fi like a trapped animal. Thrashing desperately. Roper pins on his back, but can't pry the gun out of his fingers.

Headlights radiate over the crest of the hill. Coming qui Roper sees this. He rolls out of the way, abandoning the  battle for the gun. Clarence struggles to his knees. Turn the weapon on Roper... A speeding cab lunges over the top the hill. Clarence turns, trapped in the searing headligh Tires squeal. Brakes lock. Clarence is transfixed... WHAM He's launched through the air like a ragdoll... His body  lands limply 30 feet down the street. The CABBY gets out his vehicle.
Jesus Christ. What was he doing?!
Roper walks down the hill to the body. The cabby follows.
There was no way I could miss him.
Roper ignores the cabby. He looks down at Clarence's body contemplating something.
This isn't my fault.
Shut the fuck up!
The cabby immediately clams up.
Get on your radio and get the police  here.
Roper stares at Clarence's body, steel-eyed.
Korda is led in again. An expression of surprise register on his face when he sees who's waiting for him.
Roper is sitting stoically behind the plexiglass wall.
Dons a smug expression and takes a seat. He picks up his  receiver as Roper picks up his.
If you try again to hurt me or anyone  I know, I'm going to have you killed.
Korda feigns total innocence.
What in the world are you talking  about, Mr. Roper?
Roper takes out a photograph and holds it up against the  glass.
Here's a picture of your cousin  Clarence. That gentleman standing  over him is the coroner.
Korda's face tightens. He drops the innocent act. His  countenance is now a study in hate.
I used to have an apartment, a car,  jewelry. I had a fucking eight  thousand dollar watch. Now look what  I have.
He motions around.

You're threatening me? You think I  give a fuck? You think you can scare  me off? (a laugh) Why don't you come in here and kick  my ass? Get some of your guard friends  in here to help. I'd like that.
Roper glares at him mounting rage.
(smirking) He really shook you up, didn't he?...  I've got ten years worth of appeals  to figure out how to fuck with you.  Who knows? Maybe some scumbag lawyer  will get me out on a technicality.
Roper sits there, suddenly feeling powerless.
You came here to threaten me? That's  a laugh. Maybe you should BEG me...  Go ahead. Get down on your knees.
Roper leaps from his chair and smashes the receiver again the plexiglass wall.
You motherfucker, I swear I'll kill  you!

The guard rushes over and restrains Roper. Wrestles him a from the glass wall. Roper pushes him off and gathers him He gives Korda one last stare. Korda sits there smirking  back at him... Roper turns his back and walks out.
McCall is practicing his negotiating techniques in a mirr
I'm here to help you.
Not quite right. He adjusts his stance. This time puts a  little hand movement into it.
I'm here to help you. Talk to me.
He's still not satisfied.
Sequence omitted from original script.
Captain Solis pokes his head in the door, he's been looki for McCall.
We got a situation at the V.A.  Hospital. The responding officer has  requested a negotiator.
Where's Roper?
He's on his way. Get over there.
A VETERAN wearing green fatigue is dangling another WHEEL BOUND VET over the edge. Fourteen floors up. The two fron wheels are literally hanging out there in space.

(rambling incoherently) I can't fight this technology. They  have microprocessors made in totally  sterile environments. I've seen those  places. Everyone is dressed in white.  It's like paper clothing, man. They're  not even human.
Vet 2 is struggling to stay in the chair and not be tippe into the street 150 feet below. He is, needless to say, v panicky.
Dave, don't do this, bro. Pull me  in. We'll do a few laps in the park  and figure out some other way.
But he's not getting through to his friend.
I can't help this, man. Do you have  any idea what those microchips look  like? How small they are when they  put them in your brain?

Leading to the roof. A COUPLE OF COPS and MEMBERS OF THE  HOSPITAL STAFF peek out at the vet as he continues to ran and rave. McCall arrives at the top of the stairs. OFFICE #4 sure looks happy to see him. McCall takes a peek out o the roof. He isn't happy about what he sees.
When we got here, he was already  doing his balancing act. I was talking  to him, but it made him more agitated  so I backed off.
Why is he up there?
Something about a microchip in his  brain.
Who is he?
A NURSE answers him.
David Adler. He likes to be called  Dave. The other guy is Walter  Sinclair.
We hear the urgent cry of the vet in the wheelchair.
Somebody help me out here. Somebody  stop him.
The nurse turns to McCall.
What are you waiting for?
Another negotiator is on his way.
We can't wait for another negotiator.  You have to do something.
What about the doctors?
He hates all the doctors. He says  they're in on the conspiracy.
Where is everybody? He's going to  kill me!
McCall takes a deep breath and steps out onto the roof.

McCall moves slowly across the tar paper roof. Clouds ove threaten rain. Vet 1 turns to him suddenly, wobbling the  wheelchair. Vet 2 shrieks and nearly goes over. McCall's  heart jumps into his mouth.
Get the fuck out of here!
McCall is tense and stiff. He stammers.
I... I'm Kevin. I 'm here to help  you, D... Dave.
You can't help me, man.
So much for McCall's opener. Now what?
He's high on something, man. Give  him some thorazine or something.
Dave ignores Walter.
No one can help me. They're  controlling my mind.
McCall moves a couple steps closer.
Who's controlling your mind?
Whoa!... The government. They control  everybody's mind. You're too fucking  stupid to know that?
McCall fumbles for the right response.
This has nothing to do with Walter.
They want Walter dead!
Cops keep spectators back from the building. Fire trucks rescue vehicles are on the scene. Everybody looking strai up watching the wheelchair with its occupant dangling ove the side of the building.
Walter sits stock still in the wheelchair drenched with s eyes closed, praying.
Dave, look at me.
Dave obliges. He looks at McCall with eyes that have lost the battle for sanity. McCall is momentarily frozen by th eyes. Beads of sweat have formed on his forehead.
Tell me what's wrong.
Particles, man. I feel them all the  time. I feel them in my arms and  legs man, that's how they punish me.
How can I help you with the particles?
It's not just the particles man,  it's the whole fucking machine, this  is how they get assassins to operate.  It's been this way since the cuban  missile crisis.
Dave starts to look over into the street, he tips Walter  forward, Walter shrieks in mortal fear. White knuckles th armrests of his wheelchair and then:
(blurting out) They have less power over you if you  look into my eyes.
Huh?
McCall even surprises himself with that one. It was a she act of desperation. He holds his breath and waits to see  what the effect is. Dave turns back around.
Huh?
Roper's truck comes speeding down the street, lurches to halt. He leaps out and speaks to a FIREMAN.
Whata ya got?
Some nuts dangling a guy over the  edge in a wheelchair.
Can you get a net out here?
Negative. It's 14 floors up. No nets  gonna hold a fall from that high up.
McCall nods slowly. Sweat pouring off him.
We've been onto them for a long time.
A glimmer from Dave. Maybe McCall is a kindred spirit.
Let me show you something.
Now he's got Dave's interest. McCall slowly takes out his beeper.
See this. I'm jamming them, Dave.  I'm jamming their frequency so they  can't control your mind anymore.  Don't you feel that? You don't have  to do what they say.
Dave listens to his head.
He's jamming them, Dave. Pull me  back in.
You see, the particles are gone,  they can't punish you anymore.
Dave tries to feel for particles. Tears form in Dave's ey
Tell my dad.
Tell him what, what do you want me  to tell him?
Tell my dad I'm sorry about the watch.
I'll tell him. Where does he live.  We'll get him on the phone right  now.
Dave is suddenly lost in thought again. His expression tu to a frown:
I hate fucking Springfield.
Is that where you're family lives?
Then with sudden swiftness.
I still hear them, man. You can't  jam them. They've got the technology,  man. They've got the satellites,  Jack. They keep shooting beams off  those satellites. What power do I  have?
Dave pushes the wheelchair forward. McCall LUNGES for the wheelchair but doesn't make it. Walter SCREAMS as he fall
NOOOO!
freefall down toward earth in SLOW MOTION. The wheelchair turns end over end. People SCREAM as Walter IMPACTS with pavement. The wheelchair CRASHES down nearby.
Sequence omitted from original script.
McCall looks over the edge at Walter's twisted body below Then he grabs Dave and wrestles him down, cuffing his han behind his back. The Cops and Medical Staff Members rush to restrain.
The crowd is dispersing. Roper is talking with some of th other cops. McCall storms out of the Vet Hospital and dow the stairs. Roper moves toward him.
McCall!
No response. McCall gets into his ND Sedan car and fires up.
McCall!
Roper races over and manages to jump in just as the car  screeches away from the curb.
McCall doesn't even seem to have registered that Roper is the car with him. He drives. Stone-faced. Roper studies h for a beat.
Where are we going?
Moving POV thru windshield of car, we see a freeway sign  that says "Golden Gate Racetrack."
Establish grand stands.
Sequence omitted from original script.
McCall pounds over to the betting window. Roper leans up  against the window beside him. Watches.
Give me a twenty dollar four-six  exacta.
The six is scratched.
This throws McCall for a beat.
Then give me a fucking four-seven  exacta.
The teller punches out the ticket. McCall takes the ticke and pounds over to box seat area. Roper follows a couple steps behind, giving him some space.
McCall sits down in the same box as the last time. Roper  sits down next to him.
The horses go into the gate.
McCall watches intently as the horses spring from the gat (The track announcer's call plays over the scene.)
Come on four horse! Come on Seven  horse!
Roper isn't watching the horse. He's watching McCall. Wat him redirect all his pent up emotion. Understanding exact how he feels. McCall is screaming his head off.
Come on four-seven... Come on...  Come on... Come on...
The horses cross the wire. The four and seven finish mid- pack. McCall hangs his head in despair. He didn't give a  shit about the race. He looks inconsolable.
It might have happened no matter who  was up there.
Bullshit! Would it have happened to  you?
Maybe... There's one thing you have  to remember... You don't create the  situations. You can only try to save  people from them.

I thought I could do it. I was so  damn sure of myself. But I didn't  know what to say. The words wouldn't  come. My mouth turned to mush. You  make it look so easy, Roper. But it  is not. It's not easy. (beat) It's a different job than looking  through the rifle scope.
That it is.
A long silent beat.
How many have you lost?
I look at it as how many I've saved.  That's the way you've got to look at  it.
And what about the ones you don't  save?
You live with it... and they haunt  you. It doesn't leave.
And what if you can't live with it?
You've got to decide that for  yourself.
McCall squeezes his eyes closed. He can still see that ve falling to his death. Roper can see McCall's pain.

I've lost three. One of them was my  partner. I think about them every  time I go into a situation. (a beat) There's a million people in this  city with all kinds of twisted shit  going on in their heads, and the  bitch of this job is that we expect  to go out every day and do the  impossible -- to somehow control all  this craziness... and we can't. (a beat) Nobody's faulting you for this,  McCall. My advice is you let yourself  off the hook.
McCall hears him but is still undecided.
I don't know... I don't know...
Roper gets up, stands over McCall, puts a hand on his  shoulder.
Let's get out of here.
McCall slowly gets up and they walk out.
It's a small interview room. Korda sits opposite bail bon JOHN HAWKINS (white, grizzled, forty).
What the fuck... You bring me all  the way over here to tell me you've  got no collateral! What do I look  like to you -- Santa Claus? I'm a  bail bondsman!
No, no, see what I'm sayin' is, I've  got the --
Pick up a fucking phone for chrissake!  You think I got time for this crap?
Hey, hey, I got shit on the outside.  I got somebody cashing it in for me  and --
Hawkins gets up and goes to the door.
Gimme a fuckin' break.
Alright, alright, look, man, look,  just leave me your card. I can get  it to you by tomorrow night.
Hawkins looks at him skeptically for a beat. Then pulls o his BUSINESS CARD and hands it to him. He walks out the d as we HOLD on Korda -- pocketing the card.
Establishing shot.
CLOSE-UP of a glass of wine being poured. PULL BACK to re Roper and Ronnie all dressed up for a special evening. Th waiter hovers as Roper tastes the wine.
(snootily) It has a nice "nose".
The special this evening is braised  sweetbreads with a white truffle  sauce on cracked bulgar.
Roper looks at him a long beat.
That's my favorite. (smiles) Why don't you give us a minute.
The waiter retreats. Roper looks across the table at Ronn as she sips her wine.
You like this place?
It's very nice.
I guess you realize that there's  something special that I want to  talk to you about.
She didn't realize that. Now she's getting nervous.
There is?
For the last week things have been  going pretty well between us. I think  we've been doing a good job getting  intimate and all that stuff...
Now she's really worried.
Yeah?
...Let me just show you.
Roper reaches into his coat pocket.
Scottie, we should think this over  before we...
He pulls out two airline tickets.
Tahiti.
Ronnie is immensely relieved.
Ohhh... A vacation... Yeah that sounds  like a great idea.
Roper notices her relief and for the first time realizes  what she was thinking.
Oh you thought I was going to ask  you...
Ronnie averts her eyes, a bit embarrassed.
Oh, no-no-no-no-no... Let's go to  Tahiti first and see if that works  out...
Roper picks up his menu and peruses it.
I assume you're having your usual --  the "air dried venison".
The wheels of a laundry cart, moving slowly down the hall white metal door slides open, and the cart passes through
As the cart rolls into the room TILT UP to see
pushing the cart. He stops. A GUARD (guard #3) stands wit his back to Korda. He's on the phone.
Got another load.
Rack 'em up. (into the phone) Look, man, if it doesn't make it  down here by five it's not my problem.
As the guard continues, Korda hangs several garment bags, zipped and tagged, onto an ELECTRIC TROLLEY -- similar to the kind used by dry-cleaners to move clothing.
All done.
Korda pushes a button and the trolley STARTS TO MOVE. The guard, still on the phone, buzzes open the door.
We hear Korda wheeling the cart out the door.
on the door sliding shut.
Hold a beat. PANNING SLOWLY around the room to FIND -- su bag's moving on the trolley. BOOM DOWN to FIND Korda's fe just as they lift off the ground and disappear behind the bags.
hanging onto the trolley as it moves along the wall and t down through an opening in the floor and into...

as it loops around a large room, carrying him toward the  back wall. The metal ridges of the trolley CUT into his  fingers, drawing blood. Then he drops down, and quietly  rummages through other bags of clothing. He tries on a pa of pants but they come up to his ankles. He looks like he about to go wading. As he rips them off and reaches for  another pair...
Korda appears around a corner, dressed in street clothes, holding a CLIPBOARD -- moving steadily toward camera.
A female civilian EMPLOYEE heading in his direction. As t pass he nods and she nods back. Then Korda passes through door at the end of the hallway and into...
Sequence omitted from original script.

The door closes behind him and locks with the loud SNAP o metal. Slowly, with deliberate steps, he moves down the corridor toward the door at the other end, past the first GUARD (g #3) -- enclosed in bullet proof glass.
step by step. The voices of prisoners, muffled behind thi glass.
trying to stay cool, his heart pounding. Then...
Hey!
Korda FREEZES, then slowly turns to FIND... A prison GUAR (#1) moving toward him.

head_text.subj: MOVING CLOSER AND CLOSER TO KORDA

text: ...Yeah?
The guard then stops in front of him and holds up his han
You dropped your card.
Korda takes THE CARD given to him by the bail bondsman.
You guys are the scum of the earth.
Just tryin' to make a living.
Korda turns and walks out the door into...
It's the final step before getting out of the building. A small room with another GUARD (Latino; guard #2) behind g and several TV monitors. A BLACK WOMAN (forty-five) is ar with a LATINO GUARD.
I don't know what to tell you, mam,  your brother ain't here. Try San  Bruno.
I just came from San Bruno -- they  sent me here!
I'm sorry. Then I don't know where  he is.
Korda, fidgeting behind the woman impatiently, holds up h card...
Listen, can I just sign outta here?
What do you mean, you don't know  where he is?! You can't just lose  somebody!
(to Korda) Who are you again?
Johnny Hawkins. Bail Bonds. I gotta  be over at county in fifteen minutes,  alright?
Johnny who?
(to Korda) Can you believe these people?
It's the criminal justice system.  What can I tell ya? It's a mess.
The guard shoves the sheet under the glass.
Alright, alright, just sign.
Korda signs the sheet. The guard pushes a button. The met lock SNAPS, and the door POPS open. Korda takes his card sticks it in the woman's coat pocket.
If you find him, gimme a call.
And Korda walks out.

It's a small parking area, with security gates on either  end, and a ceiling of heavy steel wire open to the sky. T are three or four CARS parked against the wall. Korda che inside the first car, looking for keys and finds none. Th the second, and the third until...
Hey!
Korda turns sharply to find the LATINO GUARD (guard #2),  holding a clipboard, walking quickly toward him.
Hold on a second here.
Is there a problem?
The guard walks up to him. They're standing between the c
You signed out twice.
I what?
Look, why don't you just come on  back inside for a second.
Wait a minute, lemme see that.
As the guard shows him the sign-in sheet, Korda removes t PEN from his own clipboard.
Well, that's funny, I wonder how  that happened.

In a flash, Korda PLUNGES the pen DEEP into the guard's  throat. The BLOOD jumps out of his throat, onto the windo of the car as the guard, gagging in stunned silence, slum to ground. He then falls backward between the two cars,  drowning in his own blood.
Sequence omitted from original script.
Empty. New front door. Unpainted. Frame splintered from w Roper shot it open. We hold a beat... HEAR ROPER & RONNIE coming up the stairs. Laughing. The door opens. They ente
How come in those foreign movies the  young girl is always with some fat,  old guy.
In Europe women find older men very  sexy.
Roper closes the door.
When I get old and fat, I'm moving  to Europe.
Ronnie suddenly remembers something.
I forgot to leave food for Paco.  He's probably starving.
She walks back toward the kitchen. Roper takes a seat on couch. Flips on the TV. Rubs the back of his neck.
Damn, my eyes are tired from reading  that movie.
She moves down the hall to the kitchen.
(doggie voice) I'm sorry, Paco. I forgot --
But Paco isn't lying on his pillow like she expected. Cur
Paco?
She turns around walks back down the hall... Where could be?... She walks into the bedroom.
Paco?
He's not in here either... She walks back into the hallwa Frowns.
A figure leaps out of the bathroom doorway!... Big scare. It's Paco. He nearly knocked her over. He stands on his h legs, paws on her shoulders. Breathing in her face.
Paco, have you been eating my face  soap, again?
Roper standing at the other end of the hallway. Tense as wire. Gun at his side. One look at his demeanor tells Ron something is very wrong.
(very concerned) What is it, Scottie?
Roper untenses. Puts away his gun.
Korda escaped.
And you think he'll...
Her voice trails off. He can see she's worried now, too.
Hey, I'm on edge a little. Let's  relax. I'm sure he's just going to  try to get out of town. Anyway we  leave tomorrow.
He puts his arms around her waist.
Why don't we do some of that European  movie stuff.
She puts her arms around his shoulders.
I don't think you're old and fat  enough for me.
Use your imagination.
ANGLE looking up at her window... The light goes out.
A suitcase THUMPS to the ground. Looks like somebody pack for a six month trip around the world.
McCall grimaces as he lugs the bag toward the truck.
You sure you packed everything? Maybe  you forgot your bowling ball.
Ronnie stands on the doorstep.
I sent that ahead, wise guy.
Paco is on the sidewalk exploring from tree to tree. Rope calls to Ronnie from the stairway.
Why don't you come back up with me,  Ronnie.
I think I'll stand out here in the  sun.
Roper is still very edgy.
It's better if you stay inside.
She climbs up the stairs toward him.
You've got to calm down --
Sequence omitted from original script.
Roper reaches the top of the stairs.
Ronnie, come on baby, we gotta go.  Time to get movin'.
Roper moves into the room, listening. There's no response
(continuing) Ronnie?
She doesn't answer. He calls out again, moving through th living room.
(continuing) Ronnie, where are you? Time to go.
No answer, the room is very quiet. Roper eases his PISTOL out from under his shirt, moving more urgently now, check out the bathroom, bedroom...
(continuing) Ronnie.

Then he HEARS Paco, WHINING. He moves around the entrance the kitchen. The back door is open, Paco standing in the  doorway. Roper rushes forward, quickly looking outside, t alley way empty. He senses a presence behind him, spinnin McCall standing in the doorway to the kitchen. Roper's lowers the weapon...
(continuing) She's gone.
McCall sees on the kitchen table, a folded piece of GLASS PAPER, just like the one Korda gave Roper at the jewelry  store.
(nodding) Scott...
Roper sees it, approaching, barely able to unfold the edg a momentary tremble in his hand.
That son of a bitch. If he...
We PUSH IN as his fingers open the paper... revealing ins a MICRO CASSETTE TAPE.
(continuing; to himself) He's fucking with you, Scott, be  cool... keep your head.
CLOSE ON a TAPE RECORDER, Korda's VOICE heard over the  speaker.
(filtered) I got your lady, Roper. (laughs)
Roper and McCall are listening closely to the tape.

(continuing) You got something that belongs to  me, and I want it back. (beat) Twelve-fifteen, Mare Island, North  Entrance off Dixon. Building twenty- eight, by the dry docks. (beat) I so much as smell another cop, I'll  be sending you parts of this bitch  for a month.
Roper punches off the tape.
He's gonna kill her no matter what.  If I take him these jewels he's gonna  kill me and her.
So what do you want to do?
That's a chance I gotta take.
Then we better get moving... But  there's no way we can get the jewels  out of evidence.
Roper stares at him, the wheels beginning to turn...
Sequence omitted from original script.
Roper is standing at the counter to the steel-caged prope room. On the other side is FRANK, the property sergeant o duty. The two men speak in hushed, urgent tones...
Scott, we go back a long way but you  can't expect me to do this!
Frank, this guy is a psychopath and  he's got Ronnie. It's the only way  I'm going to get close to him.
Then go to the Lieutenant or the  D.A. with it, for Christsakes. You're  asking me to put my fucking job on  the line!
They'll never approve it, you know  that. Besides, I involve the  department and she's dead. I got one  chance with this guy, Frank, alone. (beat) He killed Sam and he'll kill her.
Frank just stares at him, compassion and anger tearing at him.
(continuing) What if it were Mary? (beat) You'd break every fucking rule in  the book... wouldn't you?
Frank continues to stare at him, a long beat.
I hope to God I never have to make  that decision...
He pushes back from the counter.
(continuing) ...and this conversation never  happened. I never saw you today. Now  I gotta go take a leak.

He turns and walks away. Roper looks down, SEEING that th drawer beneath Frank's counter has been left slightly ope Roper reaches over, easing it further open -- inside a se of KEYS. He looks around, then takes the keys.
I owe you one, Frank.
He walks down the hallway.
CLOSE ON the SATCHEL Korda used in the robbery. WIDEN TO REVEAL Roper and McCall, Roper at the wheel, McC reading a folded MAP featuring MARE ISLAND.
Mare Island is an abandoned shipyard,  cranes, high buildings... he'll be  in place where he can see everything. (to Roper) How are we going to get me in there?
Good question.
Roper thinks a moment, then turns, looking out the back o the pickup, in the bed a loose CANVAS TARPAULIN. He and M study the tarp a beat, then turn, looking at each other..
WIDE VIEW reveals the immensity of the abandoned facility At one end near the chain link fence, Roper's pickup  approaches the gate.

Roper cautiously drives toward the gate -- the CHAIN secu the gate has been cut. Roper swings open the gate. As he drives past we see that the bed of the truck has be loosely covered with a TARP. Roper drives on, winding through the maze of roadways, hu buildings and equipment dwarfing the truc PRODUCTION NOTE The idea is to take us into the facility to sell that it' abandoned, immense, eerie in it's scale -- a ghost town. end up wherever we want for the next scene.

As he rounds a corner, approaching the dry dock area, hug CRANES and mothballed SHIPS in the b.g. He parks near a  building, a weathered SIGN reading: BLD 28. Roper shuts o the engine, leaving the keys in the ignition. Taking the  satchel he opens the door.
Roper steps out, eyes scanning the buildings, the cranes. Korda could be anywhere up there, watching.
KORDA'S POV through the filthy windows, Roper far below,  standing beside his pickup.
As he moves away from the truck, holding the satchel.
Korda!
In response he HEARS Korda's VOICE, eerie, almost a whisp coming from everywhere and nowhere as if emanating from t ground and the buildings all at once.
(filtered) Nice of you to make it, Roper. Take  your jacket off, put it on the hood.
Roper complies, his eyes searching the buildings, where i his voice coming from?
(continuing) Now, over to the chains, to your  left.
Roper SEES a chained off section nearby. Roper takes a fe steps when Korda's voice stops him...
(continuing) But first, let's have a look under  the tarp. Pull it back.
A momentary anxious look from Roper, then he walks to the bed of the truck, pausing a moment, gripping the cover be whipping it back, revealing... Ronnie's LUGGAGE.
McCall supported under the frame by a makeshift HARNESS a his waist and legs.
All right, move it.
McCall watches as Roper heads away, then releases the har lowering himself to the ground. Quickly he moves the SMOK LEATHER GLOVES he was wearing, burned by contact with the hot exhaust pipe.

Reaches the the chained area, REVEALING an empty DRY DOCK easily one hundred feet deep and five hundred long. At the bottom of the dry dock is a PORTABLE RADIO, the  acoustics of natural amphitheater so intense you could he a whisper -- the source of Korda's voice.
(continuing) Throw in and your piece.
Roper tosses his PISTOL into the dry dock.
And your back up.
Roper removes the PISTOL from his ankle HOLSTER, tossing Korda's VOICE cuts the eerie silence.
(continuing) Walk under the cranes and down the  alleyway. At the end, turn right.  Building thirty-six.
The RADIO CLICKS OFF. Roper walks towards the megalith CRANES, passing under th then heads down the alleyway created by the tall building
McCall, his RIFLE CASE on his chest, watches as Roper tur the corner and heads down the alley way.
McCall rolls out, scrambling for the cover of the buildin Slinging the case over his shoulder he finds a LADDER lea up the side of the building, beginning to climb.
Walking down the alley way, nearing the end.

McCall moving along the edge, looking down. He spots Rope moving fast to keep him in sight. He comes to the edge of the building, having to walk acro a narrow RAMP to get to the next building. He looks down, Roper turning the corner, McCall moves on, removing the RIFLE from its case as he goes.
Leaves the alleyway, a complex of hanger-like buildings  revealed. To his far right is a building, a SIGN reading: BLD 36. He clutches the satchel, heading towards it.

McCall negotiating another precarious crossing between  buildings. He spots Roper, eyes quickly searching the roo tops and buildings for the sniper's position. He sees it, across the way, a location covering the buildings where R is now walking. He heads out.
Walking towards building 36, passing by a towering, glass fronted building on his right, his eyes are searching the roof tops of the buildings around him.
(to himself) Where the hell are you, McCall?
As Roper passes a set of partially open ROLLING DOORS to glass-fronted building, he's startled by Korda's VOICE fr within:
Right there, Roper.
Roper's eyes go to building 36, still fifty yards away.
Shit.
Roper stops, slowly turning towards the doors.
Come on in, there's someone just  dying to see you.
Roper hesitates. He turns a bit in profile, eyes searchin
(loudly) Where are you?
POV TELESCOPIC SIGHT: Focusing on Roper, his lips moving. McCall, heaving for breath, has just dropped down into  position, providing a view of Roper and the inside of the glass fronted building.
Right here, Scott.
He touches the LASER SIGHTING attachment to his scope, a beam activated...
From inside the building Korda's VOICE:
Get your ass in here, Roper.
Just as Roper starts to move he SEES the red laser DOT on the back of his hand -- McCall is up there, right behind  him. Roper moves inside.

Lying prone inside the operator's booth, steadies his RIF looking through the scope. TELESCOPIC POV: He can see Roper enter, his field of visi limited inside the building where the light penetrates, t room cast in HARD SHADOWS. He MOVES to the windows, all either painted white or so  obscured with grime and dirt he can only see vague shapes and shadows inside. He MOVES BACK to the opening, Roper n just inside.
Stay cool, real easy...

Cavernous and dark, a jungle of huge MACHINES, LATHES and EQUIPMENT once used in the design of nuclear submarines. Roper moves a few feet inside, remaining in the light and keeping his face in three-quarter profile to McCall's  position.
Where is she, Korda? I want to see  her.
From the darkness beyond...
Walk to the table.
Roper walks to a steel SHOP TABLE.
(continuing) Open your shirt.
I'm not wearing a wire. This is just  between you and me.
Shut the fuck up and do what I say!
Roper puts down the satchel, unbuttoning his shirt, holdi it open.
Satisfied?
Open the bag, dump everything on the  table.

Roper opens the bag, the JEWELRY and the dozens of GLASSI ENVELOPES spill out onto the table. He lays the satchel o its side, the bottom facing Roper. Taped to the bottom is short barreled .45 AUTOMATIC.
It's all there.
Spread it out.
Roper spreads the pile out across the top of the table.
Only the jewels, Korda, you've got  my word.
A long beat...
Show me something.
Without looking Roper reaches to the pile of GLASSINE  ENVELOPES...

Palmed in his hand, the ENVELOPE containing Ronnie's diam Roper, without looking, 'digs' into the pile, holding up GLASSINE ENVELOPE between his fingers, still holding the  palmed envelope. He starts to toss the envelope in his  fingers...
(continuing) Not that one.
Roper hesitates, then drops the envelope, his hand moving over the pile...
(continuing) Right there, the one in front...  yeah, that one. Toss it.
Roper reaches for the envelope.

As he flips the palmed envelope into his fingers with the skill of a card shark, exchanging it for the one Korda  indicated. He tosses it across the room... From the shadows Korda's hand reaches out, picking it up. long beat.
(continuing) I'm impressed. I didn't think you  could do it. What did you have to  do, steal them?
Yeah.
(wry) That's not going to look too good on  your service record.
I'll worry about that. Let's get on  with it.
Korda LAUGHS as he slowly emerges from the darkness.
My sentiments exactly.
On the floor he SEES a shadow cast - Korda. He moves to t windows... inside the vague, blurred OUTLINE of a man. Hi scope goes back to the satchel and the .45 taped to the  bottom.
Wait for the right moment, Scott...
Korda moves closer to the light, tossing an ATHLETIC BAG Roper, in his hand an AUTOMATIC PISTOL.
Fill it up. Just in case there's a  homing device in the other one.
Roper slides the jewels into the second bag, eyeing the . on the bottom of the satchel.
(continuing) Now bring it over here.
Roper hesitates, but all he can do at this point is play time, he moves forward...
Watching Roper as he moves away from the satchel and the  gun.
Oh, shit...
He moves the SCOPE ahead of Roper, SEEING Korda's shadow  cast on the floor, still unable to see him.
(continuing) All right, Scott, bring him out.
Roper growing closer to Korda's position.
That's far enough. Bag on the floor.
Roper hangs onto the bag -- there's 'four million in jewe in there -- all he has to bargain with.
I've kept my end. Ronnie first.
Korda reacts in mock surprise.
Oh, shit, in all the excitement I  almost forgot. She right here...
A LIGHT SWITCH is thrown, a bank of lights behind him com ON, illuminating a massive FLAT BED CIRCULAR LATHE. Roper eyes in horror go to...
Tied to the lathe bed spread eagle. Some distance from he body a CUTTING DEVICE is positioned over the lathe bed. Roper looks into Ronnie's terrified eyes.
Be cool, Ronnie, I'm gonna get you  out of this.
He turns back, Korda grinning at him.
No shit, this I gotta see...

Korda swings into position a CONTROL BOX, the buttons hel down with TAPE. Korda pulls free the tape, the huge lathe beginning to TU very slowly, the cutting device activated... if the table keeps turning, Ronnie's body will soon be under the blade (PRODUCTION NOTE: Lathe will be cutting into a section of steel plate, demonstrating what will happen to Ronnie. Korda presses the STOP BUTTON, the lathe stopping. He rel his finger again, the lathe turning. He stops it. We can see that Korda is immensely proud of his 'creation his focus more on sadistic payback than anything else at  this point.
(continuing) Fuckin' cool, huh? I rewired the  switch. You see, you have to keep  your finger on the button or the  little lady gets cut...
He releases the button, the lathe turning towards the cut device. He stops it again, holding the button.
(continuing; grins) Right in half.
He eases towards Roper, extending his arm on the control  box, holding the button down.
Through the SCOPE, he can see Korda as he steps into view The CROSSHAIRS settle on Korda's upper forehead.
Hold it right there...
His finger tightens on the trigger...
Korda holds the control box towards Roper.
But then, that's not my problem.
He releases the button and the box, the lathe turning, Ko grinning at Roper...
The RED DOT centered on Korda's forehead...
Light's out, fucker...
And then Roper's HEAD fills the scope, the red dot GLOWIN on the back of his head. In shock, McCall releases his finger...
Jesus!
Roper moving to the control box, pressing the stop button stopping the lathe...
You see, it's out of my hands.
Roper looks at the box, Ronnie's life literally in his  hands...
Sequence omitted from original script.
Through the SCOPE, Roper's head blocking the shot to Kord
Roper, move...
But Korda bends down, picking up the BAG, stepping back a from Roper, clearly out of McCall's line of fire.
Well, hate to run but I've got a  plane to catch. You take good care  of the little lady, hear?
As Korda walks down the corridor of the huge machine shop we now SEE a CAR parked near the end facing us. Korda sud stops, turning, gesturing to the car.
(continuing) How careless of me. You see, there's  only one way out of here, and you're  standing right in the way. (grins) You could move, but then...
He shakes his head at Roper.
(continuing) Sure hate to be in your shoes.

He turns, walking quickly towards his car, TALKING, LAUGH to himself. Roper looks to the car, then back at the SATCHEL where th .45 is still taped to the bottom. But Roper can't move, u to change his position more than a foot or two. He looks  around him, no way to stop the lathe if he releases the  button.
He can see Roper holding the box, but nothing else.
What the hell's going on?
Now Korda reaches his car, hopping inside, STARTING it up In desperation Roper looks back at the satchel, then turn calling out...
McCall, stop him, stop the car!
Korda REVVING the engine...
McCall reading Roper's lips...
What car?
He swings the SCOPE up but the back of the machine shop i blocked by his vantage point. Then he HEARS the faint SQUEALING of tires. He lowers his scope, holding, waiting...
Korda at the end of the long building, beginning to  accelerate.
Turns toward McCall's position...
McCall!
The CAR now screaming down the long corridor...
McCall still can't see the car...
The car now closing in on Roper, but Roper holds his grou
McCall, shoot the son of a bitch!
Korda bearing down on Roper.
Bye, bye, cop...
Holding his position, eyes widening in fear...
The CAR comes into view, the CROSSHAIRS on the windshield but the glare off the window is obscuring any shot of Kor McCall takes aim and FIRES...
The bullet punches through the window, catching Korda's l shoulder, BLOOD flying. Korda whips the wheel in shock...

Spinning out of control, hitting a table piled with MACHI PARTS, sending them flying... But the car is now swapping ends, still flying right towa Roper, who can't move...; who won't move. The car flies past him, the SIDE MIRROR catching Roper's  shirt, tearing it, a flash of BLOOD from his arm... The car then collides with a series of PIPES crossing the floor, STEAM erupting in every direction as the car then  slams into several PROPANE BOTTLES stacked near the bench a series of EXPLOSIONS ripping through the building. . .
Thrown to the floor by the explosions, releasing the butt as...
Hits the GLASSED-IN ROLLING DOORS.
The CAR explodes from the building, GLASS FLYING, the car rolling, flipping over, coming to a rest on its wheels,  driver's side away from McCall's position.
On the floor, recovering. He catches a quick glimpse of t bottom section of the lathe, a GEARBOX, the gears turning
Turning, the cutting blade inching towards Ronnie...

Staggers to his feet, grabbing the control box, pressing button... nothing happens, the lathe still turning, SPARK coming out of the box, it's SHORTING... Only a few more  seconds... Desperately his eyes search the floor, SEEING a HUGE WREN He grabs the wrench, jamming it between the GEARS in the  gearbox, the gears shuddering violently, threatening to c the wrench... Roper runs to Ronnie's side, frantically pulling at her b the cutting blade now paused an inch away from her...
Hammering and clanking, the wrench can't last a heartbeat longer...
Pulls the last of the restraints away...
Just as the massive gears crush the wrench, the table  turning...
The blade passing directly over Ronnie's position as Rope hauls her away, holding her in his arms.
Korda is slumped over the wheel. He looks dead. McCall sl his rifle over his shoulder and moves towards a DRAIN PIP attached to the side of the building.
Roper holding Ronnie, easing her away from the still turn lathe.
Scottie, Scottie...
It's all over, babe, it's all over.
McCall slides to the ground via the drain pipe, but...

Korda is not quite dead... The door eases open, Korda rolling to the ground, bag in hand, AUTOMATIC in the other. He looks up, SEEING McCall. He OPENS FIRE, McCall hitting the deck and taking cover a BULLETS hit the wall around him. McCall whips out his REVOLVER, RETURNING FIRE, a GUN BATT ensuing.
HEARING the shots outside, hauls Ronnie out of the way,  keeping her low to the ground.
Stay here, don't move.
Scottie...
Do it!

He pushes her towards the cover of some machines, then  crouching low to the floor, recovers the .45 from the bot of the satchel. He heads out towards the other side of th cavernous, machine-choked building.
FIRES a round at Korda, then trying to close in on the ca runs from his cover into the opening...

Leaps up and FIRES, McCall taking a slug in his leg, knoc him to the ground. The SLIDE to Korda's AUTOMATIC has kic open, out of bullets. He drops the gun, picks up the BAG runs alongside the machine shop.
Exits the machine shop, SEEING McCall on the ground, Kord nowhere in sight. Combat-style Roper runs to McCall, drop to his side.
McCall, you all right?
(in pain) I'm okay. Korda... went down the  side of the building...
Stay put.
Roper sprints towards the building, racing alongside it,  catching a glimpse of Korda just as he disappears around other end. Roper charges on...

Korda runs past the building, still clutching the BAG. He runs past another building, heading towards the dry dock  area and Roper's pickup. A moment later Roper emerges fro the machine shop just in time to see Korda round the corn of the next building.
Clearing the building sees Roper's PICKUP. He runs to it, jumping inside, finding the KEYS in the ignition. He star the truck, pulling out, just as Roper runs into view.

With the truck accelerating towards him he raises and FIR two bullet holes in the front WINDSHIELD, missing Korda, truck still speeding towards him. Roper's gun jams. Roper leaps, sliding forward on the hood, almost falling as he  grabs on to the empty window frame and the windshield wip blades for support, his WEAPON flying from his hand.
Speeds around the buildings and down the alleyways, whipp from side to side, trying to shake Roper off, Roper hangi on for dear life.
(shouting) Give it up, Korda, you got away with  nothing! Nothing but a bag of shit!  It's all fake!
Korda can't help but look at the OPEN BAG beside him.
(continuing) Go on, you stupid fuck, look at it!  It's all shit! A hundred dollars  worth of glass!
Korda reaches in, grabbing a handful of the COSTUME JEWEL He can't believe it, it's all fake!
You fuck!!!

Korda goes crazy, slamming the truck into the side of a  building, trying to throw Roper, but Roper hangs on. Korda then caroms off the sides of buildings, left, right SPARKS flying, then smashes into BOXES, CRATES, anything can see stacked alongside the road way, but Roper stays p clinging on with all he's got, swinging from side to side avoid the obstacles. Then Korda SEES ahead a huge pile of BOXES, WOOD FRAMING, PALLETS, TRASH, stacked at the side of a building. He ham the pedal, driving the right side of the truck into the  pile... BOXES, WOOD, PAPER, DEBRIS flying everywhere, thr the open fron window as well, Korda shielding his eyes wi his arm as OBJECTS fly around in a mad flurry inside the  cab...

In the maelstrom lets go his grip, grabbing the upper fra of the window and assisted by the speed of the truck, rol over the top of the cab, landing in the bed of the truck  along with BOXES, LUMBER, and TRASH.
Clears his eyes, looking up, Roper is gone! He LAUGHS  hysterically... he knocked him off!

head_text.subj: ROPER IN THE BED OF THE TRUCK

text: Leaning out the passenger's side SEES they are approachin the dry dock area. In the bed of the truck, along with the BOXES, SUITCASES other objects, he sees several long 2x4's. Grabbing a BOA he braces himself against the cab and then in one swift  movement, stands, swinging to the driver's side, driving 2x4 through the side window, through the steering wheel,  past the dash and catching the tip of the ACCELERATOR PED pinning it to the floor. As Roper releases the board it WEDGES inside the door fra locking the wheel and the accelerator, the engine SCREAMI wide open. Korda reacts in panic... Roper clings to the cab, looking over the top, the DRY DO looming towards them. He prepares to jump...
Suddenly SEES the approaching dry dock. He jams on the br but it's not enough, the truck racing towards the edge...
Vaults over the edge of the dry dock as Roper runs down t bed, leaping off the tail gate, arms windmilling as he go airborne... The truck plummets towards the bottom...
Lands in a huge pile of CARGO NETS and CARDBOARD BOXES, p near the edge of the dry dock...
SCREAMS in wide-eyed terror as...
Hits the bottom of the dock, EXPLODING into flames.
Roper and Ronnie lay on a gorgeous white sand beach, drin from coconuts with umbrellas in them.
I've never seen sea so blue. Tahiti  is magnificent, Scottie.
Yeah, I could get used to this  Paradise shit.
Roper hails a waitress, serving the hotel guests.
(to waitress) I'll have another Pena Colada. And  this time could you shave the ice,  please.
Oui, Monsieur. Right away.
Roper stretches back into his chaise lounge, adjusting hi Ray Bans. A purring cat without a care in the world.
Scottie?
Hmm?
I've been thinking.
TWO GORGEOUS FRENCH GIRLS unstring their bikinis, floppin topless on the beach in front of them.
Hmm?
Things have been going pretty well  between us, haven't they?
(sensing something's  up) Yeah.
You've changed you know. I don't  think there's anything you can't do  once you put your mind to it.
Uh-oh. He removes his shades to get a better look at the  curve ball.

I was just thinking... (here it comes) There's something special I want to  talk to you about. (he's listening) I think it's time we went to a whole  other phase in our relationship. (pointedly) A deeper level.
(no longer relaxed,  sitting up) A deeper level?
That's right. We've got to bare it  all. Here and now. 'Cause I think  I'm finally ready to go for it...

(cutting her off at  the pass) Whoa! Wait a minute, Ronnie. Hold  on. I know it's beautiful here. The  sun, the sand, the sea and all that  nature shit can really get to you.  But we've got to keep our perspective  here. This place isn't real. This  isn't reality.
Scott...
I mean I said this trip should be a  'roadtest'.
...the hell are you talking about?
I'm talking about... What are you  talking about?
I'm talking about me 'n' you stripping  down on this beach and gettin' you  know... 'naked in Tahiti'.
You talkin' about gettin' 'nekked?' (off her look) Shit, I thought you were talkin'  bout, you know... the "M" word.
You thought I was talking about  getting married?!
She laughs her amazing laugh.
I'm talking about taking our clothes  off, silly. You said you would.
AD LIBS dialogue below as CAMERA CRANES BACK and we ROLL  CREDITS over...
You crazy? With all those people  around?
Know what you are?! You're a prude,  Roper.
The hell I am!
(amused) Prude.
First you want me to put on one of  those skinny ass bathing suits --  tongs or thongs or whatever you call  them -- with my butt cheeks wrapped  around a piece of dental floss... No  way.
Over her laughter we...
